text: hi. my actual app project contains a recyclerview adapter with a lot of view types. this viewtypes can be resused in other adapters. so i asked my self what is the best way to handle clicks on this viewtypes. should i use interfaces (listener) but then i have a lot to implement and forward it with another listener from the adapter to the activity/fragment which handles the click… i´ve created an example with interfaces (<https://gist.github.com/2add947981b28959c48a.git>)
are there any better solutions to handle clicks?
I’ve done something similar where I instantiate the adapter and pass it the listeners, I use myRecycler.getChildPosition(view) inside the clicklistener to figure out which item I’m dealing with
inside the recyclerview I add the listeners inside onCreateViewHolder
<@U08KKN48P>: perhaps just create an 'addOnClickListener' method with a viewType and Listener argument where the listener would get fired if clicked on the viewType specified?
